description: Juiciest, most delicious chicken dog I've ever had! Soooop yummy! I would definitely come back to this place. It's sooooo good!
author: Nandi R.

description: Great dogs! Had the salty dog and it was right on! Ordered the chili fries , also excellent! Ask for Owen or Rainey and they'll set you up nicely!
author: Curtis L.

description: I love hot dogs. And these are the best. Especially for a quick bite, I hit up this place often. Delicious.
author: Rob M.

description: Amazing take on hot dogs!! Salty Dog is my absolute favorite and their potato croquettes are phenomenal.
author: Brandon M.

description: Excellent beef and chicken dog. Love the new york.  Short and sweet
author: Daniel A.

description: Holy crackers and cheese batman, this small hotdog stand is ridiculous! Great toppings BUT let's get real here. The hot dog. The red hot. The meat in tube form. IS amazing!! Nice snap with a little spice. Have a beer or 3 and come here. Do it. Now.
author: Alex W.

description: Great food, not many gems like this in San Francisco. Hard to find a hotdog spot that has great food. This is one of them.
author: Alli B.

description: You can get any dog in veggie form which I love. The buffalo dog was great. I'll be back because well it's the best thing after drinking in the 'stro.
author: Mark S.

description: Now that los shucos is a thing of the past :( you are my go-to wiener shop!! The prices are good, the service is very friendly, and the dogs are delicious. I have tried the Bahn mi, Reuben, and good morning? It's the one with a fried egg and bacon....divine food coma.....right near the Castro muni stop, and nestled between hot cookie and the Castro theatre, it's really convenient for a treat yo self evening that won't break the bank!
author: Caddy M.

description: Great Dogs. Friendly staff. It's my regular eating place when I stop by the Castro both drunk and sober.
author: Ben C.

description: Love this place, can't get enough of this when I'm black out drink. Thanks guys for being a staple in my life.
author: Captain Muffin D.

description: Moving from the Midwest, I was thrilled to find a pretty legit Chicago style hotdog.  The bun was perfect and the beef seemed like good quality.  The place was clean and the service was excellent.  There's only about space for 4 people to eat inside, but it's awesome for grabbing a dog on the go.
author: Colby J.

description:
What they're selling is condiments.  There just happens to be a hot dog in there, somewhere.  FIVE DOLLARS for the cheapest hot dog !?!?  Come on, it's a hot dog.  You can buy a whole package at a grocery store, for five dollars or less.  
Very strange decor (a few sheets of plywood, tacked together.  Not at all inviting.
Walk down the street, and check out, "Sliders," where the burgers are sizzling over the flaming grill.  It makes me want one.  Plus, there's a whole buffet of FREE condiments from which to choose.  Plus, they have places to sit down, while you eat your burger.  THAT'S the set up that "Dapper Dog" should be emulating.
As things are now, I predict that "Dapper Dog" will be out of business by the Fourth of July.
author: Eddie W.

description: Now that they'e found their groove - I'm a big fan!   Great wieners, great toppings.  The tables out side are an added plus.
author: Ken P.

description: I think the hot dogs have too many bells and whistles.  I got the Wake Up Dog and while the the bacon was nice, the egg was perhaps too much as I couldn't actually take a bite with the egg and the hot dog at the same time.  It also felt dry because no sauce coated the bottom of the bun. I suppose I could have handled that by adding some ketchup or mayo (though it seems that they didn't have any mayo, which I find to be a bit odd and a super quick fix); however, with all the bells on top, it would have been lots of wet bites of egg and cheese and still dry bites of hot dog. I was also disappointed that they were out of the croquettes.
author: Jeremy G.

description: This place is awesome and the staff are friendly and helpful. Chris was very helpful especially. I don't usually eat hotdogs, but the alternatives late at night are few. I decided I didn't want to eat pizza so I had a hotdog. I had a chili dog and it was awesome! Highly recommended. Thanks Chris!
author: Frank K.

description: I LOVE THE BAHN MI DOG! So delicious! I recommend it with onions and the chicken dog. So good. Also, the staff here is so sweet. Bassel, Carlos, and crew will take good care of your hot dog needs. Rumor has it, they're launching hot dog sliders. So innovative! Can't wait!
author: Zoe M.

description:
4 Stars for the toppings and bun, 2 stars for the Chicken hotdog which tasted like a cheap supermarket dog.  It also took almost 4 minutes for the guy to make my Bahn Mi dog and I was the only person in the place.  Also they had one of those dumb ipad registers which took the guy over a minute of hitting and rehitiing buttos to ring up.

$6 dog plus tip and tax was about $8, there are better things to get around here.
author: D H.

description: Staff was very friendly and helpful, the place was clean and the food was delicious! Had the bahn mi dog, highly recommend it! Great experience :)
author: Kaylie L.

description: Gross. Got the Reuben dog and the hotdog itself was not great, kind of salty and no distinctive flavor. The sauerkraut was alright but the "cheese" was horrible, not Swiss, something like feta? And the dressing was nothing like Russian. Burped up gross hot dog the rest of the night. Ew!
author: Tim N.

description: Great service. Great hot dogs. Got the San Francisco hot dog and it was nothing short of amazing. More surprisingly, the onion rings here are some of the best I've had in the city!
author: Jonathan H.

description: Good place, the wake up and the banh mih are really good. Next time gotta try those ctoquettes! Nice that it's open late also. Only downside is it's a bit slow for a hot dog place
author: Kenjo H.

description: I'm not a huge fan of hotdogs, we'll let me rephrase, I am now a huge fan of hotdogs, these hotdogs! The loaded potato croquettes are my new favorite thing! I want them with every meal!
author: Joseph A.

description: SO GOOD! I've been looking forward to partake for weeks and it did not disappoint! Delicious dog & the best staff. :D Can't wait to return for more!
author: Alana D.

description:
Just opened and I tried their classic veggie dog
is was good, grilled not boiled
and they had good buns
I'll be back
author: Damion B.

description: Great place.  Super tasty, quality menu, friendly, clean, fast, open late, checks all the important boxes. Thank you
author: jon s.

description:
A place that knows what it wants to do and does it well.  First off, their hot dogs are creative and tasty.  I find myself thinking about getting a hotdog there on the way home.  In particular I like their Bahn Mi and Chicago Dogs.

The service is really friendly and the owner (Bazel? Basil?) is very passionate about what he does.  Every time I go back they make things slightly better and fix some broken processes.

Why not 5 stars?  Two reasons:

1) I'm not a huge fan of the prices (i.e. could be a dollar lower), but it is high quality good food.  However, I shouldn't complain.  It's worth it.

2) What makes me most unhappy is the lack of good sides (fries, salad, cole slaw, beans, etc.).  They have chips there and croquettes but nothing fantastic.

I've heard that they'll be keeping their favorites up on the menu and changing/trying new dogs every so often.  I'm excited to try all their current dogs and the new creations that will be coming soon.
author: Tom L.

description: the loaded potato croquettes we're my favorite. luckily this place wasn't full, good customer service.  the dogs are good too!
author: Octavio C.

description: a greasy hot dog place in the castro im a fan love this place ill be back
author: Leigh G.

description:
I fear for the success of Dapper Dog as it seems to be very poorly managed in a dramatic way. We were so excited about the prospect of this place, it seems like such a great fit for the neighborhood and they have a unique product. The first time we went, at about 1PM on a Sunday, there was a sign on the door saying that they had run out of ingredients and that they wouldn't be opening that day. Really? They couldn't make a run to one of the many markets within walking distance to pick up supplies? The second time we tried on the subsequent weekend, this time at noon on Sunday (which is supposed to be the time they open), we waited patiently with other customers outside until about 12:10, when the sole employee unlocked the door, popped his head out and said that he needed another 30 minutes to prep because he was the only person there. This obviously is not the fault of that employee, he was gracious enough under pressure. The fault lies squarely with the management for understaffing and poor planning. 

We will not be planning another attempt, needless to say. I can only imagine how many other potential customers are feeling similarly disenchanted. What a shame.
author: James W.

description: Tried a classic dog here for the first time today , and it was DELICIOUS !!! Good bun, excellent beef.  Will be back!
author: suzanne e.

description: Finally a good hot dog spot. Quick, fast and a nice array of different dogs to try - persoal favorites are the Reuben Dog, the Bahm Mi Dog (Genuis - A Bahm Mi hot Dog!) and the Chicago Classic.  Prices are affordable and a great alternative to a late night snack other than pizza.  This place is great.
author: Chris M.

description: I found the "New York Dog" inedible and threw it away after a few bites.  Undercooked very salty dog with no "snap" to the casing. Sauerkraut was the wrong texture, mushy without much taste.  Yellow mustard? Not on a New York.  Ugly presentation, wrapped in foil which covered everything inside with mustard making it hard to eat.  An unappetizing mess, and it took 15 minutes. No Hot Link, Bratwurst, Bockwurst, Italian, Polish, etc., just beef, chicken, or veggie sausages.  Ugly, cramped space. Nice people, (they offered to refund my money) but completely overwhelmed by the Noir City crowds at the Castro theater.  They don't seem to have enough space to cook more than a few dogs at a time. Rosamunde, or Top Dog does a much better job.  But those places are more about the sausages than the toppings. Maybe I'll try a Chicago sometime, since Moishe's Pippic is no more. But I'm wary.
author: John R.

description: I love it!  Choice of Beef, Chicken or Vegetarian Hot Dogs.  All sorts of toppings and they are great Hot Dogs!  They even have great cole slaw and Fries!  The  buns they put the dogs on is great - not a typical hot dog bun - but almost like a roll.  Everything is made fresh and the flavor is awesome!  Try the New York dog!
author: Herb B.

description: Writing this review makes me wish I was there right now!  I came across this place on my way to get my beans at the ever wonderful Castro Coffee Company.  I had the Philly Dog and it didn't disappoint.  At first bites, I was loving the cheesesteak with toppings and then I realized there was still a tasty hotdog waiting for me!  Mmmm, I'm going to have to drink more coffee so I can head back there sooner.
author: Miguel D.

description: Love this place! Great selection of high quality hot dogs, must try the chicago dog and the Banh Mi! Will decently be back for more.
author: S K.

description: The hot dogs are great. I've had the classic and the cubano. The cubano is tops. It's the best place to get a quick bite to eat while waiting in line at the Castro Theatre.
author: Mark A.

description: They've got a cute space and friendly workers. I had their 'classic' hotdog which was delicious. I'm looking forward to coming back here late at night after a trip to a bar.
author: Mike B.
